skill.name: raffle-winner-picker
skill.description: Picks random winners from lists, spreadsheets, or Google Sheets for giveaways, raffles, and contests. Ensures fair, unbiased selection with transparency.
skill.summary: Picks random winners from lists, spreadsheets, or Google Sheets for giveaways, raffles, and contests...
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged 26 patterns including cryptographic functions and shell commands. Upon evaluation, all findings are false positives. The MD5 usage is for non-security purposes (generating random seeds), shell backticks are example code snippets in documentation, and C2/reconnaissance keywords are normal JSON field names in a skill report file.

content.value_statement: Running contests and giveaways requires transparent random selection. This skill uses cryptographic randomization to select winners fairly from participant lists.
actual_capabilities: Select random winners from participant lists using cryptographic algorithms
Generate verifiable random selections with seed-based reproducibility
Support multiple winner selection with duplicate prevention
Handle various input formats including CSV and plain text lists
limitations: Cannot verify participant eligibility or detect fraudulent entries
Does not integrate with social media platforms for automatic entry collection
Cannot handle real-time streaming entry collection during live events

use_cases.title: Instagram Giveaway Winner Selection
use_cases.description: Pick random winners from Instagram comment participants for product giveaways and promotional contests

use_cases.title: Conference Door Prize Drawing
use_cases.description: Conduct transparent random draws for conference attendees to win prizes and sponsorship gifts

use_cases.title: Discord Server Nitro Giveaway
use_cases.description: Randomly select community members from participant lists for Discord Nitro and other digital rewards

prompt_templates.title: Basic Winner Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Pick one random winner from this list of participants: Alice, Bob, Charlie, Diana, Edward

prompt_templates.title: Multiple Winners
prompt_templates.prompt: Select 3 random winners from my participant list for first, second, and third place prizes. Ensure no duplicates.

prompt_templates.title: Seeded Random Draw
prompt_templates.prompt: Pick 2 winners from this CSV file using seed 12345 so I can verify the results later

prompt_templates.title: Large Scale Raffle
prompt_templates.prompt: I have 5000 participants in participants.txt. Select 10 unique winners and show me the complete selection process for transparency.

output_examples.input: Pick one winner from: Alice, Bob, Charlie, Diana
output: Selection Method: Cryptographic random number generation

output_examples.input: Select 3 winners from my 50-person participant list

best_practices: Always announce the selection method and seed value before conducting the raffle for transparency
Save the complete participant list and random seed to allow independent verification of results
Conduct the random selection publicly or record the process to build trust with participants
anti_patterns: Do not modify the participant list after announcing the raffle deadline to maintain fairness
Avoid running multiple selections without documenting each attempt as this appears manipulative
Never manually override random results based on preferred outcomes as this defeats the purpose

faq.question: How does the random selection ensure fairness?
faq.answer: The skill uses cryptographic random number generation to eliminate bias and ensure each participant has equal probability of winning.

faq.question: Can I verify the raffle results were truly random?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides a random seed that allows anyone to reproduce the exact same selection results independently.

faq.question: What happens if I have duplicate names in my list?
faq.answer: Each entry is treated separately. If you want unique participants only, remove duplicates from your input list first.

faq.question: Can I pick multiple winners without replacement?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports selecting multiple winners and ensures no participant is selected twice in the same draw.

faq.question: What input formats are supported for participant lists?
faq.answer: The skill accepts comma-separated lists, CSV files, and plain text files with one participant per line.

faq.question: Is the selection method legally compliant for official contests?
faq.answer: The randomization is cryptographically sound, but you should consult local regulations for specific contest compliance requirements.
